# About the Parabola Center

*"If you are free, you need to free somebody else. If you have some power, then your job is to empower somebody else."* – Toni Morrison

Parabola Center is a nonpartisan think tank of legal and drug policy experts coming together to protect people, not corporations. Our mission is to provide everyone with the tools to be part of the arena where policy gets made.

Drug laws are changing because of a mass movement of everyday people. Our work is for that civil rights movement, which puts equity and justice at the heart of drug policy and promotes a fair, open, and regulated marketplace.

After 20+ years learning and creating cannabis policy, working on campaigns, practicing law, and serving the public, and we'd rather use that experience to benefit everyday people over rich clients. We see our job as keeping the power with the people.

It's a myth that people don't care about policy details -- in our experience, the more people get involved, the better the policy. That’s where Parabola Center comes in. We provide the resources necessary to advocate for concrete, equitable, workable policies that put people ahead of corporate profits.
advisors_text: Parabola Center is grateful to our respected advisors who have been generous with their evidence-based and integrity-based expertise. Our advisors collectively bring deep experience and a wide range of legal, science, and policy perspectives aligned with our goals of equity and justice.

founders.caption: Shaleen Title: CEO
founders.description: [Shaleen Title](/shaleen-title) is an attorney and drug policy activist who has been writing, passing, and implementing equitable cannabis laws for over 20 years. In addition to her role as CEO of Parabola Center, she currently serves as a distinguished fellow in cannabis policy at The Ohio State University College of Law’s Drug Enforcement and Policy Center and as vice chair of the Cannabis Regulators of Color Coalition. She is a frequent lecturer and consultant on cannabis policy and has testified before governmental bodies around the world about restorative justice in marijuana laws. From 2017 to 2020, she served as an inaugural commissioner of the Massachusetts Cannabis Control Commission, implementing that state’s voter-passed legalization law.

founders.caption: Richard Juang: Legal Director
founders.description: [Richard Juang](/richard-juang) is a Massachusetts attorney with several decades of experience in a wide range of civil rights and justice movements. He is a co-founder of the Parabola Center. Previously, he served as assistant general counsel for AIDS Action Committee of Massachusetts and as a staff attorney for Alternatives for Community & Environment. Richard holds a JD from Northeastern University School of Law, a PhD in English from Cornell University, and bachelor’s and master’s degrees from Stanford University.

founders.caption: Shanel Lindsay: Entrepreneurship Director
founders.description: [Shanel Lindsay](/shanel-lindsay) is an attorney, executive, and medical marijuana advocate from Boston, Massachusetts. As founder and president of Ardent Cannabis, Shanel has developed new treatment methodologies and products that increase patient control, access, and efficiency, and hopes that these advances will also have a positive impact on eroding the stigma and discrimination associated with cannabis use. She was an author of the law that legalized cannabis in Massachusetts and was appointed by the state treasurer in 2017 to serve on the Massachusetts Cannabis Advisory Board.
